#Text=Syrian army bombs Damascus suburbs after allegedly using chemical weapons on them
#Text=Friday , August 23 , 2013

#Text=After the Syrian government denied the army used chemical weapons against the densely populated eastern Ghouta region of Damascus on Wednesday , armed forces heavily bombed the neighborhood yesterday .
#Text=Reports say anywhere between 100 and 1,300 people were killed in Wednesday 's alleged chemical attack , but there are no reports of injuries or deaths in yesterday 's bombings .
#Text=Many of those killed appeared to be children .

#Text=Some of the pictures and video coming out of the country do n't show blood and dismembered bodies , but instead show , according to witnesses , those who died from apparent suffocation ; some were foaming at the mouth and others were having convulsions .
#Text=One video posted to YouTube purportedly shows a young girl who survived the alleged attack , yelling " I ’m alive , I ’m alive . "
#Text=At one point , according to The Washington Post , the girl even tries to convince the hospital official she is still alive .
#Text=The bombings come as United Nations observers began to arrive to investigate claims of chemical weapons use elsewhere in the nation .
#Text=According to Russian officials , the Syrian government is ready to give UN observers " maximum cooperation " while they perform their investigation .

#Text=" We hope that the results will clarify the issue and will help to dispel numerous speculations around the alleged use of the Syrian chemical weapons while simultaneously creating a positive background for the moves towards the start of the political process of settlement of the Syrian crisis , " Aleksandr Lukashevich , Russia 's foreign minister , said yesterday .

column1: #Text=Syrian officials say the alleged chemical attack was staged and carried out by rebel forces to " draw attention to their cause " ahead of the arrival of UN observers .

#Text=Deputy Secretary-General of the UN , Jan Eliasson , called the alleged chemical attack ' shocking ' and hopes the Syrian government will allow UN observers into the neighborhood as soon as possible .

#Text=" We see the need to investigate this as soon as possible ; no matter what the conclusions , this represents a serious escalation with grave humanitarian and human consequences , " said Eliasson who also added there is no confirmation that chemical weapons were used in Wednesday 's bombing .
#Text=A previous attempt by the UN to end the violence in Syria failed .

#Text=In May of 2012 , a UN convoy was hit by an IED ( improvised explosive device ) while a human rights group reported a Syrian military attack on civilians at a nearby funeral in the town of Khan Sheikhoun in Idlib province .
#Text=Later that year in August , a 300 person team left the country after their mandate expired , and was never renewed .
#Text=Commander of the 2012 observation team General Babacar Gaye expressed frustration against both the Syrian armed forces and rebels for not allowing the UN to complete its mission .
#Text="

#Text=The UN 's 2012 mandate was to ;  monitor a cessation of armed violence in all its forms by all parties [ and to ] monitor and support the full implementation of the Joint Special Envoy of the United Nations and the League of Arab States six-point-plan . "

column1: #Text=Part of the plan included both sides working and cooperating with the UN special envoy , commitment to ceasing hostilities , and the Syrian army ceasing troop and tank movements against rebels in " population centers " throughout the country .
